segments.text: Oh, look at these kids, they're definitely up to something.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is precariously balanced on that wobbly stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's tilting, I can see its legs splayed out, ready to go.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's reaching deep into that cookie jar, quite a daring move.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His little sister is right there, hand outstretched, eagerly waiting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They're totally focused on their sweet prize, oblivious to their own danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just a few feet away, completely absorbed in her dish.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I imagine they feel quite triumphant getting away with this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This could end with a big crash and a lot of tears.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That stool really looks like it’s about to give way any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They are so brave, or perhaps just incredibly naive about gravity.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope they get at least one cookie before disaster strikes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole setup is a recipe for a minor kitchen catastrophe.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They’ll probably remember this cookie heist for years to come.
segments.speaker: PAR
